repo.description: Vim-fork focused on extensibility and usability
repo.name: neovim

body:
Problem: Using `<c-c>` does not follow precedent (from `checkhealth`, `Man`, etc.) for closing "information windows".

Solution: Use `q` for close mapping.

comment_data.body:
btw, if anyone says "this shouldn't override my `q` mapping", that doesn't matter. Because for most users, having to *restore* that mapping for the pager is a bigger cost than the inverse.

There needs to be some guaranteed single-key way to exit the pager. Overriding that should be opt-in, not opt-out.
comment_data.diff_hunk:
@@ -47,8 +47,8 @@ function M.tab_check_wins()
         local parser = assert(vim.treesitter.get_parser(M.bufs.cmd, 'vim', {}))
         M.cmd.highlighter = vim.treesitter.highlighter.new(parser)
       elseif type == 'more' then
-        -- Close more window with Ctrl-C.
-        vim.keymap.set('n', '<C-c>', '<C-w>c', { buffer = M.bufs.more })
+        -- Close more window with `q`, same as `checkhealth`
+        vim.keymap.set('n', 'q', '<C-w>c', { buffer = M.bufs.more })

comment_data.body:
As far as I see it, the two main interactions for the message window are
1. searching,
2. yanking.

Any (reasonably common) mapping related to that is privileged and should not be clobbered. Everything else is up for grabs; this includes `q` for macro recording.

(Not arguing; just recording my rationale for posterity.)
comment_data.diff_hunk:
@@ -47,8 +47,8 @@ function M.tab_check_wins()
         local parser = assert(vim.treesitter.get_parser(M.bufs.cmd, 'vim', {}))
         M.cmd.highlighter = vim.treesitter.highlighter.new(parser)
       elseif type == 'more' then
-        -- Close more window with Ctrl-C.
-        vim.keymap.set('n', '<C-c>', '<C-w>c', { buffer = M.bufs.more })
+        -- Close more window with `q`, same as `checkhealth`
+        vim.keymap.set('n', 'q', '<C-w>c', { buffer = M.bufs.more })

comment_regular_data.body: Do we want both, and `<Esc>` in addition? I'm not partial to `<C-c>` but @justinmk suggested it. All three close the message grid more-prompt. I refrained from adding the other two because I considered them to be more likely to be mapped already by the user. But I do think it's fine to overwrite for this window.
Yes, you are right; we should mirror the current `more` prompt as closely as possible.

Can you not map escape to close the window, please? Some users, including me, use it to clear search highlighting (:noh), and since with the extui PR messages are now searchable, this escape mapping would be pretty unpleasant.

I guess that is a bigger question: Should the `messages` window behave more like the more prompt, or more like a normal window? In the latter case, mapping `q` would be an issue, too, since it breaks macro recording.
In any case, I think `<c-c>` doesn't have any precedent yet in Nvim, so I'd prefer to avoid introducing it. In this case, `q` is the only halfway reasonable mapping (due to the `:checkhealth` precedent).

(I'm in the same boat vis-Ã -vis having mapped `<esc>`, fwiw, and being able to search the output was indeed one of the main drivers of putting it in a real window.)

Yeah maybe its fine to assume users will get used to this being a regular window in which they will not expect `<Esc>/<C-c>` to close the window. Then I guess it should be _only_ <kbd>q</kbd> for the checkhealth precedence.
There'll definitely be some rough days ahead for my muscle memory ;) But I think it's definitely worth it.

Let's choose whatever feels natural. The pager will have some sort of 'filetype' or something that allows users to do what they want. If ESC and `q` feel natural, then we should map those. I don't have strong feelings on any particular choice. We can start with `q` I guess.

I think there are good reasons for avoiding `<esc>`, so `q` (only) it is. (If we come up with a better set of mappings, we should standardize them so we can apply them to all such windows, including `checkhealth` and `LspInfo` (or whatever else we want to show in a floating window that is focused by default).)
Thinking about it, I think the `:InspectTree` should get the same mapping. Separate PR, though (since backportable).

repo.description: Vim-fork focused on extensibility and usability
repo.name: neovim

title: fix(extui): close message window with `q`
